verses.text_plain: In the first year of Darius the son of Ahasuerus, of the seed of the Medes, which was made king over the realm of the Chaldeans;
verses.verse_html:
1In the first year of Darius the son of Ahasuerus, of the seed of the Medes, which was made king over the realm of the Chaldeans; ▼
▼ which: or, in which he

footnotes.body_html: ▼ which: or, in which he

verses.text_plain: In the first year of his reign I Daniel understood by books the number of the years, whereof the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah the prophet, that he would accomplish seventy years in the desolations of Jerusalem.
verses.verse_html: 2In the first year of his reign I Daniel understood by books the number of the years, whereof the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah the prophet, that he would accomplish seventy years in the desolations of Jerusalem.

verses.text_plain: And I set my face unto the Lord God, to seek by prayer and supplications, with fasting, and sackcloth, and ashes:
verses.verse_html: 3And I set my face unto the Lord God, to seek by prayer and supplications, with fasting, and sackcloth, and ashes:

verses.text_plain: And I prayed unto the Lord my God, and made my confession, and said, O Lord, the great and dreadful God, keeping the covenant and mercy to them that love him, and to them that keep his commandments;
verses.verse_html: 4And I prayed unto the Lord my God, and made my confession, and said, O Lord, the great and dreadful God, keeping the covenant and mercy to them that love him, and to them that keep his commandments;

tokens.text: him, and to them that keep

verses.text_plain: We have sinned, and have committed iniquity, and have done wickedly, and have rebelled, even by departing from thy precepts and from thy judgments:
verses.verse_html: 5We have sinned, and have committed iniquity, and have done wickedly, and have rebelled, even by departing from thy precepts and from thy judgments:

verses.text_plain: Neither have we hearkened unto thy servants the prophets, which spake in thy name to our kings, our princes, and our fathers, and to all the people of the land.
verses.verse_html: 6Neither have we hearkened unto thy servants the prophets, which spake in thy name to our kings, our princes, and our fathers, and to all the people of the land.

verses.text_plain: O Lord, righteousness belongeth unto thee, but unto us confusion of faces, as at this day; to the men of Judah, and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and unto all Israel, that are near, and that are far off, through all the countries whither thou hast driven them, because of their trespass that they have trespassed against thee.
verses.verse_html:
7O Lord, righteousness belongeth unto thee, but unto us confusion of faces, as at this day; to the men of Judah, and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and unto all Israel, that are near, and that are far off, through all the countries whither thou hast driven them, because of their trespass that they have trespassed against thee. ▼
▼ belongeth…: or, thou hast

tokens.text: unto thee, but unto us confusion

footnotes.body_html: ▼ belongeth…: or, thou hast

verses.text_plain: O Lord, to us belongeth confusion of face, to our kings, to our princes, and to our fathers, because we have sinned against thee.
verses.verse_html: 8O Lord, to us belongeth confusion of face, to our kings, to our princes, and to our fathers, because we have sinned against thee.

verses.text_plain: To the Lord our God belong mercies and forgivenesses, though we have rebelled against him;
verses.verse_html: 9To the Lord our God belong mercies and forgivenesses, though we have rebelled against him;

verses.text_plain: Neither have we obeyed the voice of the Lord our God, to walk in his laws, which he set before us by his servants the prophets.
verses.verse_html: 10Neither have we obeyed the voice of the Lord our God, to walk in his laws, which he set before us by his servants the prophets.

verses.text_plain: Yea, all Israel have transgressed thy law, even by departing, that they might not obey thy voice; therefore the curse is poured upon us, and the oath that is written in the law of Moses the servant of God, because we have sinned against him.
verses.verse_html: 11Yea, all Israel have transgressed thy law, even by departing, that they might not obey thy voice; therefore the curse is poured upon us, and the oath that is written in the law of Moses the servant of God, because we have sinned against him.

verses.text_plain: And he hath confirmed his words, which he spake against us, and against our judges that judged us, by bringing upon us a great evil: for under the whole heaven hath not been done as hath been done upon Jerusalem.
verses.verse_html: 12And he hath confirmed his words, which he spake against us, and against our judges that judged us, by bringing upon us a great evil: for under the whole heaven hath not been done as hath been done upon Jerusalem.

tokens.text: against us, and against our judges

verses.text_plain: As it is written in the law of Moses, all this evil is come upon us: yet made we not our prayer before the Lord our God, that we might turn from our iniquities, and understand thy truth.
verses.verse_html:
13As it is written in the law of Moses, all this evil is come upon us: yet made we not our prayer before the Lord our God, that we might turn from our iniquities, and understand thy truth. ▼
▼ made…: Heb. intreated we not the face of the, etc

tokens.text: upon us: yet made we not our prayer

footnotes.body_text: ▼ made…: Heb. intreated we not the face of the, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ made…: Heb. intreated we not the face of the, etc

verses.text_plain: Therefore hath the Lord watched upon the evil, and brought it upon us: for the Lord our God is righteous in all his works which he doeth: for we obeyed not his voice.
verses.verse_html: 14Therefore hath the Lord watched upon the evil, and brought it upon us: for the Lord our God is righteous in all his works which he doeth: for we obeyed not his voice.

tokens.text: it upon us: for the Lord

verses.text_plain: And now, O Lord our God, that hast brought thy people forth out of the land of Egypt with a mighty hand, and hast gotten thee renown, as at this day; we have sinned, we have done wickedly.
verses.verse_html:
15And now, O Lord our God, that hast brought thy people forth out of the land of Egypt with a mighty hand, and hast gotten thee renown, as at this day; we have sinned, we have done wickedly. ▼
▼ gotten…: Heb. made thee a name

footnotes.body_text: ▼ gotten…: Heb. made thee a name
footnotes.body_html: ▼ gotten…: Heb. made thee a name

verses.text_plain: O Lord, according to all thy righteousness, I beseech thee, let thine anger and thy fury be turned away from thy city Jerusalem, thy holy mountain: because for our sins, and for the iniquities of our fathers, Jerusalem and thy people are become a reproach to all that are about us.
verses.verse_html: 16O Lord, according to all thy righteousness, I beseech thee, let thine anger and thy fury be turned away from thy city Jerusalem, thy holy mountain: because for our sins, and for the iniquities of our fathers, Jerusalem and thy people are become a reproach to all that are about us.

tokens.text: I beseech thee, let thine anger

verses.text_plain: Now therefore, O our God, hear the prayer of thy servant, and his supplications, and cause thy face to shine upon thy sanctuary that is desolate, for the Lord’s sake.
verses.verse_html: 17Now therefore, O our God, hear the prayer of thy servant, and his supplications, and cause thy face to shine upon thy sanctuary that is desolate, for the Lord’s sake.

verses.text_plain: O my God, incline thine ear, and hear; open thine eyes, and behold our desolations, and the city which is called by thy name: for we do not present our supplications before thee for our righteousnesses, but for thy great mercies.
verses.verse_html:
18O my God, incline thine ear, and hear; open thine eyes, and behold our desolations, and the city which is called by thy name: for we do not present our supplications before thee for our righteousnesses, but for thy great mercies. ▼
▼ which…: Heb. whereupon thy name is called
 , ▼
▼ present: Heb. cause to fall

footnotes.body_text: ▼ which…: Heb. whereupon thy name is called
footnotes.body_html: ▼ which…: Heb. whereupon thy name is called
▼ present: Heb. cause to fall

verses.text_plain: O Lord, hear; O Lord, forgive; O Lord, hearken and do; defer not, for thine own sake, O my God: for thy city and thy people are called by thy name.
verses.verse_html: 19O Lord, hear; O Lord, forgive; O Lord, hearken and do; defer not, for thine own sake, O my God: for thy city and thy people are called by thy name.

tokens.text: for thine own sake, O my God

verses.text_plain: And whiles I was speaking, and praying, and confessing my sin and the sin of my people Israel, and presenting my supplication before the Lord my God for the holy mountain of my God;
verses.verse_html: 20And whiles I was speaking, and praying, and confessing my sin and the sin of my people Israel, and presenting my supplication before the Lord my God for the holy mountain of my God;

verses.text_plain: Yea, whiles I was speaking in prayer, even the man Gabriel, whom I had seen in the vision at the beginning, being caused to fly swiftly, touched me about the time of the evening oblation.
verses.verse_html:
21Yea, whiles I was speaking in prayer, even the man Gabriel, whom I had seen in the vision at the beginning, being caused to fly swiftly, touched me about the time of the evening oblation. ▼
▼ swiftly: Heb. with weariness, or, flight

footnotes.body_text: ▼ swiftly: Heb. with weariness, or, flight
footnotes.body_html: ▼ swiftly: Heb. with weariness, or, flight

verses.text_plain: And he informed me, and talked with me, and said, O Daniel, I am now come forth to give thee skill and understanding.
verses.verse_html:
22And he informed me, and talked with me, and said, O Daniel, I am now come forth to give thee skill and understanding. ▼
▼ to…: Heb. to make thee skilful of

footnotes.body_text: ▼ to…: Heb. to make thee skilful of
footnotes.body_html: ▼ to…: Heb. to make thee skilful of

verses.text_plain: At the beginning of thy supplications the commandment came forth, and I am come to shew thee; for thou art greatly beloved: therefore understand the matter, and consider the vision.
verses.verse_html:
23At the beginning of thy supplications the commandment came forth, and I am come to shew thee; for thou art greatly beloved: therefore understand the matter, and consider the vision. ▼
▼ commandment: Heb. word
 , ▼
▼ greatly…: Heb. a man of desires

footnotes.body_html: ▼ commandment: Heb. word

footnotes.body_text: ▼ greatly…: Heb. a man of desires
footnotes.body_html: ▼ greatly…: Heb. a man of desires

verses.text_plain: Seventy weeks are determined upon thy people and upon thy holy city, to finish the transgression, and to make an end of sins, and to make reconciliation for iniquity, and to bring in everlasting righteousness, and to seal up the vision and prophecy, and to anoint the most Holy.
verses.verse_html:
24Seventy weeks are determined upon thy people and upon thy holy city, to finish the transgression, and to make an end of sins, and to make reconciliation for iniquity, and to bring in everlasting righteousness, and to seal up the vision and prophecy, and to anoint the most Holy. ▼
▼ finish: or, restrain
 , ▼
▼ make an…: or, seal up
 , ▼
▼ prophecy: Heb. prophet

footnotes.body_html: ▼ finish: or, restrain
▼ make an…: or, seal up
▼ prophecy: Heb. prophet

verses.text_plain: Know therefore and understand, that from the going forth of the commandment to restore and to build Jerusalem unto the Messiah the Prince shall be seven weeks, and threescore and two weeks: the street shall be built again, and the wall, even in troublous times.
verses.verse_html:
25Know therefore and understand, that from the going forth of the commandment to restore and to build Jerusalem unto the Messiah the Prince shall be seven weeks, and threescore and two weeks: the street shall be built again, and the wall, even in troublous times. ▼
▼ be built…: Heb. return and be built
 , ▼
▼ wall: or, breach, or, ditch
 , ▼
▼ troublous: Heb. strait of

footnotes.body_text: ▼ be built…: Heb. return and be built
footnotes.body_html: ▼ be built…: Heb. return and be built
▼ wall: or, breach, or, ditch
▼ troublous: Heb. strait of

verses.text_plain: And after threescore and two weeks shall Messiah be cut off, but not for himself: and the people of the prince that shall come shall destroy the city and the sanctuary; and the end thereof shall be with a flood, and unto the end of the war desolations are determined.
verses.verse_html:
26And after threescore and two weeks shall Messiah be cut off, but not for himself: and the people of the prince that shall come shall destroy the city and the sanctuary; and the end thereof shall be with a flood, and unto the end of the war desolations are determined. ▼
▼ but…: or, and shall have nothing
 , ▼
▼ desolations…: or, it shall be cut off by desolations

tokens.text: but not for himself: and the people

footnotes.body_text: ▼ but…: or, and shall have nothing
footnotes.body_html: ▼ but…: or, and shall have nothing

footnotes.body_text: ▼ desolations…: or, it shall be cut off by desolations
footnotes.body_html: ▼ desolations…: or, it shall be cut off by desolations

verses.text_plain: And he shall confirm the covenant with many for one week: and in the midst of the week he shall cause the sacrifice and the oblation to cease, and for the overspreading of abominations he shall make it desolate, even until the consummation, and that determined shall be poured upon the desolate.
verses.verse_html:
27And he shall confirm the covenant with many for one week: and in the midst of the week he shall cause the sacrifice and the oblation to cease, and for the overspreading of abominations he shall make it desolate, even until the consummation, and that determined shall be poured upon the desolate. ▼
▼ the covenant: or, a covenant
 , ▼
▼ for the…: or, with the abominable armies
 , ▼
▼ the desolate: or, the desolator
